meanings.definition: To write or print in capital letters.
meanings.sent1: I ALWAYS CAPITALIZED the first letter of my name on official documents.
meanings.sent2: Please make sure to CAPITALIZE the headings in your report.
meanings.sent3: The teacher jokingly asked if I could ONLY WRITE IN CAPITALIZED letters for the rest of the class.
meanings.sent4: In the sea of lowercase text, her name CAPITALIZED like a lighthouse in the dark.
meanings.sent5: The sign was so clear because it was CAPITALIZED in bold red letters.

meanings.sent1: The bank CAPITALIZED the new business venture with a substantial loan.
meanings.sent2: Investors are needed to CAPITALIZE the expansion of the company.
meanings.sent3: The chef joked that he would CAPITALIZE the kitchen with chocolate if he could.
meanings.sent4: Her infectious laughter CAPITALIZED the joy of the party.
meanings.sent5: The sunlight CAPITALIZED the beauty of the garden, making it glow with warmth.

meanings.definition: To consider or treat as important.
meanings.sent1: She always CAPITALIZED the safety of her children above all else.
meanings.sent2: It is crucial to CAPITALIZE the well-being of employees in any organization.
meanings.sent3: The cat seemed to CAPITALIZE the arrival of its favorite toy, chasing it around the room excitedly.
meanings.sent4: His actions CAPITALIZED the urgency of the situation, prompting immediate action.
meanings.sent5: The painting CAPITALIZED the significance of nature, depicting it in vibrant colors and intricate detail.
